column4: Argh.  I cannot get a share auto-mounted using fstab.  I have been reading about it for an hour now, and it's just not working.
theres not spaces in the share name is there?
No, there aren't.
and whats the fstab line entry look like? what messages appear when you try to mount it?
the 'samba-doc' package has some docs on samba that also give troubleshooting information that may be handy
//server/av-stuff /av-stuff smbfs credentials=/etc/.smbcred 0 0

the 'server' is pingable by the server name from the command line? on some of my simple lans. I ahve to use the ip# - not the server name.. or edit the /etc/hosts file to  match up server name and ip# properly
Should be, I have the name in the hosts file.  Let me try...
i fought for ages once.. and discoverdd a typo  in my hosts file. :(
Yes, it is fine using the host name.  I can ping the computer.
try connecting via the command line tools perhaps?  Been ages since ive done that..
Do I need to change the //server/av-stuff in fstab to read smb://server/av-stuff instead?
the use of smb:// is used by the FILE MANAGERS  much like how http:// is used.. its not for fstab entries
check that using-samba docs for examples, and trobulshooting tips.. or find some other examples on various samba web sites I guess
I figured as much, just wanted to be certain.  Beyond (perhaps) file permissions and ownership, I can't understand why it won't mount it, though.
enable samba logging - and check the logs and trouble shoot.. Its maybe some very trivial typo or other quirk
I'd be happy to do so, but I don't know how.  I'm a semi-newb.  =(
How do I enable logging for Samba?
its int he smb.conf file somewhere.
Okay, thanks.  I'll take a gander...
'samba-doc' package also :)
LOL, I don't even know where to find the samba.conf file...
I think its VERY good time to install samba-doc and read the using-samba book a little. its in /etc/samba

I was looking for the wrong file name, that's why I couldn't find it.  >.<  Nothing concerning the failed attempt to mount the share is listed.  As a matter of fact, nothing from today is listed in the file.
